intro: Amsinckia douglasiana var. eastwoodiae, commonly known as the Eastwood's sticky evening-primrose, is a flowering plant native to California. It belongs to the family Pedaliaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers that bloom in the evening, hence its common name. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in coastal scrub habitats. This variant is distinguished by its unique morphology and is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
